content.webTitle: Bookies on Red alert over Pipe in Imperial

fields.headline: Bookies on Red alert over Pipe in Imperial
fields.bodyText: Having pulled off the double with Olympian in 1993 and Blowing Wind five years later, Martin Pipe is once again gunning for a massive bonus, principally with Polar Red, in the Sunderlands Imperial Cup at Sandown on Saturday. Pipe, who also has Mr Cool in the race, is chasing the sponsor's bonus - which has been upped to £60,000 - awarded to any horse who lands Saturday's contest and goes on to victory in any event at next week's Cheltenham Festival. Pipe, who has Polar Red entered in the Gerrard Supreme Novice Hurdle and Vincent O'Brien County Hurdle at Cheltenham, said: "We always go for the double and Polar Red is due to run, but he went up 23lb for beating Eternal Spring five lengths at Cheltenham last time. "It was great to get the bonus up with Blowing Wind and Olympian. I just hope we can do it again, but it won't be easy." Polar Red, who won as he liked at Cheltenham, was yesterday installed 5-2 favourite by internet bookmakers Blue Square, followed by Tikram, Majlis, Through The Rye and Rooster Booster all on the 8-1 mark. · You've read the piece, now have your say.
